item.title: Debugging CHIP8 code
item.description: The first time I wrote a program in hexidecimal or assembly was using a made up, educational cpu called Pep8, this was before I had read anything about how to properly organize code, programming practices, and before I had read clean code. Over the last month and a half, I’ve been working on a CHIP8 emulator, which you can find here, so for the first time in a while, I’m revisiting old topics and old books on computer architecture.
